title: joker_josue
author: joker_josue
content: Lately I've been wondering if we can find out who ignored us.Is there any way to find out who ignored us?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Unless the person let you know that he put you on his ignore list.

comments.author: UserU
comments.body: That thing's best to remain private unless the user decides to make his/ hers public.Not pleasant to get harassed by the blockee after all.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: Bad idea tbh, don't you think this will create more enemies within one's circle I also believe the system is built this way to avoid confrontation and justification of why anybody would make it on a user's ignore list and for the sake of the forums harmony it's better this way!

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on January 18, 2023, 11:27:08 AMLately I've been wondering if we can find out who ignored us.Is there any way to find out who ignored us?  There's no way to tell who's ignoring you on bitcointalk forum since the feature to block or ignore people isn't out in the open. If you think someone's giving you the cold shoulder, the best bet is to message them directly and ask. It's also important to remember that not everyone may be interested in the same things or have the same communication style as you, and that's okay. Try not to take it personally, and try to respect other people's boundaries and preferences.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on January 18, 2023, 11:27:08 AMLately I've been wondering if we can find out who ignored us.Is there any way to find out who ignored us?  Try to have a conversation with the person that is in question and if he is ignoring you then he won't have a conversation with you. It is that simple. A person can have you in ignore without using the forum's ignore functionality. What then? Does it mean he is not ignoring you just because he isn't using this forum feature?People even get mad when you include them in your distrust list.Who knows how mad they'll get when they find out their "friends" have been ignoring them all along.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on January 18, 2023, 11:27:08 AMLately I've been wondering if we can find out who ignored us.Is there any way to find out who ignored us?  There is one way, although it is not 100% reliable. It happened to me several times that I wrote a post in a topic that gave a direct answer to the question, it also received merits, and then a member who is not a classic shitposter appears and writes a post that is 80% identical in terms of what I wrote. This is a more than good indicator that that member has you on ignore, because if by any chance he had read your post, he would not have repeated everything you said.Also, if you are considered an average poster with somewhat high-quality content and you have never received an answer or merit from a certain member, there is also a high probability that you are on his ignore list.

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Fortunately, I don't think I was personally ignored by anyone. If someone did, it just doesn't bother me at all.  I raised this question because I was wondering whether or not there is a tool with this information.Thanks for your feedback.Regarding ignoring a user, honestly until today I didn't see the need. I think it's easy to ignore reading what some say, without them having to resort to that option. I think it's an option that should only be used in very extreme cases.

comments.body: Did I not publish my ignore list just before the new year and was in an embarrassing interrogation from a user who was on the list? Right now I have none in my list, I don't think anyone will be soon too. If I don't like anyone then I can just skip their posts and read the next one. Let's say you are following a certain thread and reading all the posts then you accidentally read the post of your ignored person. I'm sure that your opinion about his statement will be biased since you hate the guy personally. Ignore button helps you to avoid accidental drama and create a peaceful forum experience away from people that you didn't like.
